lettuce.title: LETTUCE
lettuce.desc: Lettuce grows quickly and is easy to cultivate. Its crispness makes it attractive to consumers, and production in hydroponic systems enhances its nutritional value.

strawberry.title: STRAWBERRIES
strawberry.desc: The hydroponic system delivers nutrients and water directly to the roots, allowing strawberries to achieve higher yields, longer shelf life, and greater market value.

tomato.title: TOMATOES
tomato.desc: Tomatoes grown using hydroponics have excellent flavor and are resistant to diseases. Perfect for eating raw or cooking.

basil.title: HERBS
basil.desc: Basil is a green herb associated with Mediterranean cuisine. It grows quickly and provides a pleasant aroma. It thrives in hydroponic cultivation.

cucumber.title: CUCUMBERS
cucumber.desc: Hydroponic cucumber production is efficient and allows for cultivation without the need for soil.

items.question: What is Urban Crops about?
items.answer: We create modern urban farms that allow fresh vegetables and herbs to be grown year-round – without pesticides, without soil, and without worrying about the weather.

items.question: How does it work?
items.answer: Plants grow in a hydroponic system, meaning in water enriched with nutrients from photobioreactors. Thanks to special LED lamps, they receive the perfect amount of light, which accelerates growth and ensures top quality.

items.question: Who can benefit from this?
items.answer: Our products reach restaurants, shops, and individuals who want to eat healthy and local. We plan to expand to more cities and partner with new collaborators.

items.question: Can an Urban Crops farm be built in my city?
items.answer: Yes! Our farms can be built almost anywhere – in stores, warehouses, restaurants, or distribution centers.

items.question: What can be grown in Urban Crops?
items.answer: Mainly microgreens, lettuces, and herbs, but the possibilities go beyond that. We can tailor crops to customers’ needs.

items.question: Is it environmentally friendly?
items.answer: Yes! We use up to 90% less water than traditional farming, don’t use pesticides, and reduce transportation – which means less CO₂ emissions.

items.question: Where can I buy Urban Crops products?
items.answer: We collaborate with shops and restaurants – if you want to know if they’re available in your area, follow our updates.

items.question: Does Urban Crops operate year-round?
items.answer: Yes! Thanks to controlled conditions, we can grow plants 365 days a year, regardless of the weather.

items.question: What do restaurants, shops, and customers gain?
items.answer: Fresh, local products without artificial additives, shorter supply chains, and guaranteed quality all year long.

items.question: Can I open my own Urban Crops farm?
items.answer: Yes! If you’re interested in running your own city farm, we can help you set it up.

items.question: How does Urban Crops impact the city and people?
items.answer: We create jobs, support the local economy, and make healthy food more accessible.

items.question: Can I visit a farm?
items.answer: Of course! We organize visits – get in touch with us and we’ll arrange something.

items.question: How is this different from traditional farming?
items.answer: Our farms take up less space, use less water, and enable year-round cultivation without pesticides and regardless of weather conditions.

items.question: How can I get involved or collaborate?
items.answer: If you want to buy our products, open a farm, or simply learn more – reach out to us!
